result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deondrae E Brown

records.addlTxt: The Final Pretrial set for 11/4 is being adjourned to 11/17 at 10:00.  Court to attend Judicial conference on 11/4.
Final pre-trial on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Deondrae E Brown in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court orders all motions due to the Court by 11/1/2022.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deondrae E Brown in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defense requested an adjournment due to needing more time.  State does not Object.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
22RM025628  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS 5/16/2022

Defendant Deondrae E Brown in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Deondrae E Brown in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Discussions placed on the record. Defense requests adjournment for reasons placed on the record. Court grants Defense request. Case remains calendared before Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Deondrae E Brown in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Deondrae E Brown in custody.  
Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense in recent receipt of additional discovery and requests a brief adjournment. Case remains calendared before Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Deondrae E. Brown - #2022000966, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Deondrae E. Brown - #2022000966, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Received & Filed, PRELIMINARY HEARING of Original Transcript (24 pages) commencing 03-08-2022 by DANIELLE N. HOLCOMB.
Received & Filed, ADJOURNED HEARING of Original Transcript (3 pages) commencing 02-07-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Deondrae E Brown in court by video with Attorney Craig Robert Johnson who appears in person.  Defendant Deondrae E Brown in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense moves to dismiss. Arguments heard by the parties. Motion is denied by the Court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Sullivan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Supplemental Bail Motion
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO DISMISS
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL

Defendant Deondrae E Brown not in court, defendant in custody.   Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deondrae E Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Same appearance by the State.  Atty Matt Kline appears on behalf of the defense.
Case recalled to clarify individuals listed on No Contact Order.

Court ordered no contact with DMC (b/f, d.o.b. 9-2-1992); DMC (b/m, d.o.b. 2-22-1979)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deondrae E Brown in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Deondrae E Brown in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deondrae E Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
